breach of procedural fairness

Case remanded for reconsideration by a different official.

standard_of_review: Judicial review initiated by the applicant.

Different Crime.Crime Name: Being a member of an organization that there are reasonable grounds to believe engages, has engaged or will engage in acts of terrorism

evidence_provided: Credible evidence shows MQM involvement in systematic torture
serious_criminality: Complicity requires personal and knowing participation
nexus_to_convention_grounds: Mr. Ali is complicit in the MQM's crimes against humanity, including torture

evidence_consideration: credible evidence of MQM's violent activities

evidence_assessment: credible evidence shows MQM's involvement in murder and torture
credibility_findings: Mr. Ali was an active MQM member for 7 years, held leadership roles, fundraised, and had knowledge of the organization's violent activities
decision_reasoning: Mr. Ali is complicit in the MQM's crimes against humanity due to his active role and knowledge
applicable_regulations: Article 1F(a) excludes individuals from refugee protection if they have committed crimes against humanity
application_details: Mr. Ali's application for refugee status in Canada was challenged based on his alleged complicity in MQM's crimes
procedure_followed: Judicial review of the Immigration and Refugee Board's decision, analyzing evidence and legal precedents on complicity
result_of_case: Application dismissed; Mr. Ali excluded from refugee protection under Article 1F(a)

evidence_assessment: credible evidence of MQM's violent activities
refugee_definition: complicit in crimes against humanity are excluded

credibility_findings: denied knowledge, which was deemed unbelievable
immigration_status: refugee status in Canada was challenged
evidence_considered: Mr. Ali's testimony and documentation of MQM's activities

result_of_case: Application for a Writ of Prohibition dismissed

decision_reasonableness: failure to assess state protection adequacy
result_of_case: case remanded to a new panel
